description.narrative:
A Cassava Applied Research for food Security in Northern Uganda is a 3 year project implemented by Africa 2000 Network Uganda (A2N Uganda) and National Crops Resources Research Institute (NaCRRI). The project is designed to improve the food security situation of2,500 direct beneficiaries of which 60% will be female in districts of Lira and Oyam in Northern Uganda. The project focuses on cassava, the most important staple crop in this region. To sustainably improve the food security situation, initiatives aim to boost production and utilization and improve market access. The project is being implemented through a co-creation approach, where NationalCrops Resources Research Institute (NaCRRI), will work closely with farmers, NGOs, and the Private Sector. Project interventions will be based on applied research where NACRRI will work with farmers to evaluate and test the near-release six cassava varieties; increasing farmers# knowledge on disease management, increasing farmer access to quality cassava planting materials as well as improve quality of cassava and cassava products for better market access.
he role of A2N Uganda on this project is to mobilise and organisefarmers into groups, conduct training in leadership, business planning, appropriate agronomic practices in cassava value addition, storage, processing, branding and packaging and marketresearch. A2N-Uganda is directly connected to the communities and has strong experience of mobilizing farmers into groups and providing them with technical knowledge on cassava production process thus ensuringconsistent supply of raw materials to the processing plant. A2N will therefore install cassava chippers for each of the target groups to enhance processing as production increases

participating-org.narrative: A2N is an national NGO implementing projects in natural resource management, Food and nutrition security, market access and advocacy in six regions of Uganda that include; Mid-Eastern, Eastern, Northern, South Western, Western and Central Uganda. The immediate term focus of Africa 2000 network#s programs is to support households improve production and productivity to attain food and nutritionsecurity. In the long term however, the focus is on improving household incomes through supporting farmers to commercialize production and access markets

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
